summary:
I am a mechanical engineering lecturer who is currently focused on Physical Asset Maintenance, both in education and research. I am working on data-driven diagnostics/prognostics and design for RAMS. I am currently setting up an associate degree course in Smart Asset Maintenance and at the start of a project with partners in Design for Reliability. 

Background image of my profile shows a part of the "Map of Science", based on the work of Johan Bollen (et al) in 2009. It can be found here: http://tinyurl.com/arqu6f.

education.field_of_study: Gymnasium - with Latin and Classic Greek

publications.name: Feasibility Study for a Solid Waste Management System in Bandung, Indonesia

authors.headline: Senior adviseur basisregistraties bij Gemeente Haarlem

company.name: Hogeschool van Amsterdam | Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.description:
At the Centre of Expertise for Applied Artificial Intelligence, my work is focused on Smart Maintenance, developing a.o. a new university course in this area.

At the Faculty of Technology I work with our students Mechanical Engineering and Industrial Design Engineering on subjects such as materials selection, design methodologies and production technologies.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer / Researcher - Mechanical Engineering

profile_positions.description:
I occasionally review research and investment proposals submitted for the Horizon 2020 and COSME (Competitiveness for Small and Medium-sized Enterprises) programmes. (EX2014D201572)

Horizon 2020 is the EU Research and Innovation programme with nearly €80 billion of funding available over 7 years (2014 to 2020) – in addition to the private investment that this money will attract. It promises more breakthroughs, discoveries and world-firsts by taking great ideas from the lab to the market.
profile_positions.title: Expert Evaluator

profile_positions.description: For the past 7 years I have been the chairman of a 3-day annual conference, organised by Luxatia International in various European cities such as Berlin, Prague and Barcelona, focused on manufacturing technologies and operational excellence in manufacturing.
profile_positions.title: Chairman - Smart Manufacturing Summit

profile_positions.description:
IXDen (www.ixden.com) is a cyber-security company that applies AI and ML to secure OT data integrity at the sensor level, a cost-effective solution that significantly improves sensor integrity over a wide range of sensors, networks, and protocols. Since the AI model operates at the sensor level, with a small software agent on the controller, it can identify intentional and unintentional threats at their source – all without having specialised hardware in the process area. 

By using Machine Learning, the IXDen solution provides a multifactor approach, considering many factors and their interdependencies, not just sensor readings, so it has a higher detection rate and lower false positives.  It covers the full spectrum of threats, both intentional and accidental, and works for any device, network and protocol, detecting integrity risks that systems working above ISA-95 level 1 would miss. It works on real-time data and provides a system health indicator that can be integrated into SCADA/DCS asset management systems and cyber security systems.
profile_positions.title: Business Development Consultant - Applied AI at IXDen

profile_positions.description: Intrical (www.intrical.ai) is an AI startup at the Amsterdam Science Park building company profiles for corporate finance on the basis of text analytics and NLP. The product has now achieved the status of MVP (minimal viable product), with ABN AMRO as the launching customer. I am advising them on commercial strategy, sales, marketing and pricing.
profile_positions.title: Business Development Consultant - Applied AI at Intrical

profile_positions.description: Invitrocyte is a medical biotech company helping medical biotech companies and pharmaceutical companies in the development of new therapies and diagnostics with bioinformatics and predictive biomarker research. I have worked on building bioanalytics partnerships for the company. www.invitrocyte.com
profile_positions.title: Business Development Consultant - Bioanalytics at Invitrocyte

profile_positions.description: I was involved in the development of the new MSc program "Interaction & Behaviour in Societal Transitions" at the Institute of Communication at the HU, with specific responsibility for the themes "Digital Transition" and "Data Mining" covering the potential value, urgency and impact of the digital transition on individuals and organisations and the developments in data collection, analytics and data-driven design. My contribution covered developments in sentiment- and intent analysis (with predictive analytics and natural language processing), data visualisation, persuasive technology and affective computing.
profile_positions.title: Course developer - Digital Transformation at Utrecht University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.description: Logistical Forensics is a predictive analytics startup in logistics and law enforcement. Its SaaS product ParcelDetect is a real-time risk-based screening system for parcel shipments. It predicts and helps intercept illegal shipments, such as narcotics, counterfeited good, weapons, cultural treasures and protected animal species. I worked on a business plan for the company, customer acquisition and investor relations.  www.logisticalforensics.com
profile_positions.title: Business Development - Applied AI at Logistical Forensics (deep tech startup)

profile_positions.description:
StraightWalk GmbH is a Munich based Global Advisory firm. Founded in 2018 the company is establishing the "First Robotic Components and Exoskeleton Fund" with financial- and strategic investors. 

StraightWalk will invest in exoskeleton companies, manufacturers of robotic smart actuators and components for industrial-, healthcare- and consumer applications. 

StraightWalk will enable the portfolio companies to become market leaders in Wearable Robotics, providing high value by long-term funding, strategic and operational support and an active global network of governmental bodies, associations, academia, partners, industry experts, manufacturers, suppliers, distributors and customers along the Wearable Robotics value chain. 

www.straightwalk.com
profile_positions.title: Venture Partner - Corporate Venture Capital and Robotics

profile_positions.description:
I was part-time with the Faculty of Economics and Business Administration to help shape and deliver the Digital Innovation Lab, which is part of their MSc programme Digital Business and Innovation. 

This MSc programme draws upon multiple disciplines of business and management, including business information systems, innovation management, strategy, organization studies, marketing, and entrepreneurship. 

The Digital Innovation Lab prepares students for a role as Analytics Translator, the driving force behind the development of successful AI applications in organisations, bridging the gap between the technical expertise of data scientists and the operational expertise in the business. 

The Innovation Lab is a hands-on lab class that takes students on a journey to innovate with data and information. The class is designed around the innovation process and takes students through five stages. We start with the concept of an innovation and show where innovations come from (1), then move towards creativity (2) before we cover innovation processes (3), and then cover the value capturing aspects of innovation management by examining business models (4), marketing, and intellectual property protection (5).
profile_positions.title: Senior Lecturer - Data-driven Business Model Innovation

company.name: Data Analytics - an Ortec Finance company

profile_positions.description:
Ortec Data Analytics is a firm of 250 data scientists with a unique track record in advanced analytics. We have been an expert in analyzing data for over 35 years. We help our clients to get insights from their data and gain competitive advantage by applying these insights. 

Material-centric industries can make product improvements that feed the data machine and they can apply data and analytics to process optimisation the way information-centric industries would.  They can counter big data disruption with a combination of primary data, proprietary analytics and innovative business models. 

By using our clients'​ data innovatively, we help them implement advanced analytics and industrial IoT in use cases such as predictive maintenance, demand prediction, data-driven design, quality management, real-time supply-chain optimisation, yield optimisation, reducing energy consumption, and improving R&D project performance.

We are platform independent and our data scientists develop solutions in R, Python and work with IBM Watson, Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit and Google Tensorflow API's.  We also develop advanced analytics solutions on IoT platforms such as C3 IoT, GE Predix, SAP Leonardo, Siemens MindSphere and Bosch IoT.

I am familiar with big data project methodologies such as CRISP-DM, AgileKDD, TDSP and Stampede that can guide companies from strategic digital transformation roadmap to big data successes.

I am familiar with (scientific) programming in Python, Jupyter notebooks, GitHub development and Docker containers.
profile_positions.title: Director - Industrial Analytics

profile_positions.description:
Lux Research is an independent research and advisory firm providing strategic advice and ongoing intelligence on science-based innovation, the startup ecosystem and growth opportunities in digital, energy and materials.  Lux Research' clients include multi-national companies in a wide range of industries.

I was responsible for the development of new business opportunities for Lux Research in Europe, with a focus on the industrials, automotive, aerospace, energy and construction industries. 

In this role I worked with our corporate clients in functions such as new business development, corporate venture capital, R&D and strategic marketing, to explore research collaborations with the analysts and consultants at Lux Research with the objective to find new opportunities for profitable growth of their companies.

Clients I worked with include Volkswagen, PSA, Stora Enso, Airbus, Doosan, IKEA, GlaxoSmithKline, Air Liquide, Tata Steel, Lafarge, Tereos, De’Longhi, Novozymes, Johnson Matthey, John Crane, ITT, Victrex, Dow Corning, Alfa Laval, Danone, British American Tobacco, Reckitt Benckiser, Intesa Sanpaolo and Centrica.
profile_positions.title: Director - Technology Intelligence and Startup Evaluation

company.name: Hogeschool van Amsterdam | Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.description: I was part-time associated with the university to teach engineering students how to use materials databases such as CES to explore, evaluate and select materials in engineering design.
profile_positions.title: Senior Lecturer -  Material Selection in Engineering Design

profile_positions.description:
I was the Program Manager of the three BEng degree courses in Engineering Design, Innovation and Entrepreneurship at Windesheim Flevoland, in Almere, the Netherlands, from 2012 - 2013. I left the university to join Lux Research.

In addition to leading my team of 14 lecturers, with whom I designed and introduced a new curriculum,  I was teaching my students a wide range of different courses: Applied Thermodynamics, Applied Fluid Mechanics, Business Economics, Investment Analysis, Business Planning, Finite Element Method (FEM) with Dassault Systèmes SolidWorks CAD and Simulation, Innovation Management, Sales Management, Operations Management.

I also coached student projects in composite materials (with the National Aerospace Laboratory of the Netherlands) and advanced manufacturing technologies, such as Additive Manufacturing.

In 2014 I was invited back to the university to teach a course in Commercial Skills.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager - Engineering Design, Innovation and Entrepreneurship

profile_positions.description:
I was the co-founder of Cells4Research, a medical biotechnology startup, with specific responsibility for business development, marketing, sales and investor relations. 

Cells4research, based in Stockholm and Bangkok, supplied cell products for pharmaceutical pre-clinical studies and commissions research on cryo-preservation technologies for biological materials such as stem cell cultures. Clients include AstraZeneca, Orion Pharma, Genetic City Kiev.

Previously, I was the co-founder and Chief Commercial Officer of Siam Life Science, based in Bangkok, specifically responsible for business planning, investor relations, business development, sales and marketing.

In 2004 Siam Life Science became the first human cell technology company registered in Thailand and it had a partnership with the Thailand Center of Excellence for Life Sciences. 

The company had an office in Bangkok and a research and production laboratory at Siam Science Park in Pathum Thani.

Siam Life Science had a three-pronged business approach to generating revenue: selling cell products, out-licensing its technologies, and providing outsourcing services for pharmaceutical companies in drug evaluation/ pharmacology/toxicology.

The company developed cell lines suitable for ADME/Tox testing in drug development and develop cell products with potential applications bioartificial liver devices and cell therapeutics, including stem-cell technologies.

In 2008, Siam Life Science and the Bangkok-based AFRIMS, a division of the US Army Walter Reed Institute of Research, jointly developed an immortalized liver cell line, called HC-04, for use in malaria research, preclinical drug evaluation and safety studies and bioartificial liver devices.

The company had research collaborations with academic institutions in the US, Europe (Germany and Finland) and Asia (Thailand and Singapore).
profile_positions.title: Chief Commercial Officer  - Biomedical Technology
